> I think Ken wrote a paper on plastic synapses, is that right? - I admit
> to not reading it yet though :(

It was actually Ken's paper that really helped me narrow down what I 
wanted to do research on.  I started with just wanting to use genetic 
algorithms to evolve the topology of neural networks rather than just 
the weights (the only application I had seen previously).  From there, 
I've gradually gotten more specific in what I've wanted to address as I 
read more papers.

> I'm not suggesting you commandeer a plane but I'm guessing that there 
> is
> some pretty acurate flight sim code out there somewhere.

On that suggestion, I've emailed an old friend at NASA to see if he can 
point me towards any particular problems, topics, or other research on 
flight control systems.  With luck, he may have access to some decent 
source code as well, or know someone who does.

> Out of curiosity whereabouts are you studying? Austin?

I'm studying at East Carolina University.  Unfortunately, while my 
professors are very supportive of my research in the area, it's not an 
area that they have much expertise in.  I'm still trying to figure out 
where I want to go for a PhD.

		Mark Ahlstrom
